US: North Korea agrees to suspend nuclear activities

The United States said North Korea has agreed to suspend nuclear activities and a moratorium on nuclear and long-range missile tests. (AP, 11:30 a.m.)

Jurors hear gunfire in Mattapan slaying

Jurors in the Mattapan trial were told today that 12 shots were fired on Sept. 28, 2010, killing two men, and a woman and her 2-year-old son. (Globe, 12:44 p.m.)

Northampton hospital,
MGH to pursue merger

The deal could send more Cooley Dickinson patients to Boston, boosting Mass. General traffic at a time when it is under pressure from lower-cost competitors.

Tribe wants Taunton for casino

The Mashpee Wampanoag Indian tribe has chosen land in Taunton as the site for its long-sought tribal casino, according to a person close to the tribe.
Opinion | Jeff Jacoby

Mormon ritual no threat to Jews

The Mormon practice of "baptism by proxy" is eccentric, not offensive, because in Judaism, conversion after death is a concept without meaning.

An app for school snow days

The new app, called sNOw School, combines live weather data with information on past closings to calculate the odds of a snow day.

Primate center to delay new testing

Harvard Medical suspended new experiments at its New England Primate Research Center after the death of a fourth monkey under questionable circumstances.
